intro: Lycianthes cyathocalyx, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions of Mexico and parts of the Caribbean. The plant produces small, yellow, bell-shaped flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape, with a rough texture and a slightly hairy surface. Lycianthes cyathocalyx is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive blooms and relatively easy care requirements.
